title: Dragonhide

properties.name: description
properties.value: Dragonhide, often shortened "D'hide", is a general name for green dragonhide, blue dragonhide, red dragonhide, black dragonhide or anything made from them.

content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:Dragonhide
This article is about the item dropped by chromatic dragons. For complete item, see Dragonhide armour.

Dragonhide, often shortened "D'hide", is a general name for green dragonhide, blue dragonhide, red dragonhide, black dragonhide or anything made from them.

Dragonhides are a 100% drop from non-metal dragons along with dragon bones. They can also be obtained from looting impling jars. Adult dragons drop dragonhide of their respective colour, meaning green dragons drop green dragonhide, while black dragons drop black dragonhide. However, baby dragons do not drop dragonhide of any colour.

Dragonhides can be tanned by speaking to tanners, or trading with them. This process costs 20 coins per hide, or 45 if tanning in Canifis. Doing this turns them into dragonhide leather which can be used for Crafting. They can be made into vambraces, bodies, chaps, and shields of the corresponding dragon leather type. Each dragonhide requires a certain Crafting level in order to convert into certain Ranging equipment. This is very effective, especially when crafted in large amounts. It is recommended to train to 99 from 57 using dragonhide, as cost per experience point is not much.

Tanned dragonhides[edit | edit source]

Item Used in Crafting levels
Green dragonhide 57-63
Blue dragonhide 66-71
Red dragonhide 73-77
Black dragonhide 79-84

Used for making[edit | edit source]

Item Alchemy Hides used XP
Green d'hide vambraces 40 1,500 57 1 62
Green d'hide chaps 2,340 60 2 124
Green d'hide body 4,680 63 3 186
Blue d'hide vambraces 50 1,800 66 1 70
Blue d'hide chaps 2,592 68 2 140
Blue d'hide body 5,616 71 3 210
Red d'hide vambraces 60 2,160 73 1 78
Red d'hide chaps 3,108 75 2 156
Red d'hide body 6,738 77 3 234
Black d'hide vambraces 70 2,592 79 1 86
Black d'hide chaps 3,732 82 2 172
Black d'hide body 8,088 84 3 258

Notes[edit | edit source]

  • No Defence levels are required for wearing the respective vambraces and chaps, which are suitable for 1 defence pures.
  • Only Green dragonhide bodies require 40 defence and completion of Dragon Slayer I quest to wear.
  • Third Age ranger armour is reportedly made from white dragonhide.

{{External|rs}}
{{otheruses|the item dropped by chromatic dragons|complete item|Dragonhide armour}}

'''Dragonhide''', often shortened "'''D'hide'''", is a general name for [[green dragonhide]], [[blue dragonhide]], [[red dragonhide]], [[black dragonhide]] or anything made from them.

Dragonhides are a 100% drop from non-metal [[Chromatic dragon|dragons]] along with [[dragon bone]]s. They can also be obtained from looting [[impling jar]]s. Adult dragons drop dragonhide of their respective colour, meaning [[green dragon]]s drop green dragonhide, while [[black dragon]]s drop black dragonhide. However, baby dragons do ''not'' drop dragonhide of any colour.

Dragonhides can be tanned by speaking to [[tanner]]s, or trading with them. This process costs 20 coins per hide, or 45 if tanning in [[Canifis]]. Doing this turns them into dragonhide leather which can be used for [[Crafting]]. They can be made into [[vambraces]], [[D'hide body|bodies]], [[D'hide chaps|chaps]], and [[Leather shield|shields]] of the corresponding dragon leather type. Each dragonhide requires a certain [[Crafting]] level in order to convert into certain [[Ranged|Ranging]] equipment. This is very effective, especially when crafted in large amounts. It is recommended to train to 99 from 57 using dragonhide, as cost per experience point is not much.
